channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Georgia Institute of Technology on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Separation in Heavy-Tailed Sampling: Gaussian vs. Stable Oracles for Proximal Samplers
item.description: Stable oracles outperform Gaussian oracles in high-accuracy heavy-tailed sampling, overcoming limitations of Gaussian-based proximal samplers.

item.title: Langevin Unlearning: A New Perspective of Noisy Gradient Descent for Machine Unlearning
item.description: Langevin unlearning offers a novel, privacy-preserving machine unlearning framework based on noisy gradient descent, handling both convex and non-convex problems efficiently.

item.title: Large Pre-trained time series models for cross-domain Time series analysis tasks
item.description: Large Pre-trained Time-series Models (LPTM) achieves superior forecasting and time-series classification results using a novel adaptive segmentation method, requiring up to 40% less data and 50% less …

item.title: Precise asymptotics of reweighted least-squares algorithms for linear diagonal networks
item.description: New analysis reveals how reweighted least-squares algorithms for linear diagonal networks achieve favorable performance in high-dimensional settings, improving upon existing theoretical guarantees and…
